result.execSummary:
The defendant Brad E. Darvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brad E. Darvin in court with attorney Jeffrey John Siewert. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea entered on counts 1 & 2. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
Court accepts pleas and finds guilty. 
Other counts are dismissed and read in by the Court. 
State has complied with victim notifications. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 18 months probation on each count, concurrent. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs, including DOMAB 
- pay supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- can be discharged early, if Agent agrees and applies to the Court. 
Advised of appeal rights.
